job_title: Assistant Director of Nursing (Adon) in Tacoma, WA
pros: Friendly staff, good benefits, good pay

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Tacoma, WA
pros: Workers were always able to compromise with each other
cons: Supervisors weren't as accessible at times

review_title: love the staff, not the management
pros: people are so great here to work with, residence are very nice and talkative. the landscape is beautiful and well maintained.
cons: The management constantly asks you to do more with less. they dont hire enough people and expect you to work more hours and treat you awful if you dont. they take advantage of you and dont appreciate you for all the work you do and they demand

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Tacoma, WA
cons: low pay and lots of drama. outdated equipment

pros: Free parking and the grounds are nice
cons: Upper management demonstrates bullying behavior. Expect to get yelled at in front of others. Huge turnover and not worth the stress

pros:
- Good job for a teenager. It's definitely better than working at some fast food chain store
- People working there are awesome
- You can learn how to cook
- You can get tasty and healthy food if there's any left
- You feel like it is some sort of luxury place
cons:
- Sometimes you do things you are not supposed to do.
- I don't think there are any growth opportunities.

pros: The residents were good people and the dining experience was rewarding and a great way to improve your strengths in diet, presentation, communication and compassion.  They will teach the server much about what is good with the human race.
cons: Supervisor was weak and ineffectual.  He cared more about presentation than building loyalty with the employees. "They're just kids" was his excuse when they knowingly violated policies and when there was workplace bullying, he simply moved the victim to another area, rewarding the bully. Preferred to pretend employees were not taking drugs or wandering off or doing shoddy work. After years of working there it wears you down until you don't care either. If you dread sexual harassment, don't work as a server there. Paperwork goes missing. They discourage you getting a part-time job in other departments which is what many people need to do to pay the bills. Wage was minimum and overtime was supposedly not allowed, but many people did it.  This review is about the dining services, and not other departments.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Tacoma, WA
cons: Franke Tobey Jones nursing staff are NOT helpful. I was mistreated here. My first day of work here and I would have considered applying had it not been for the mistreatment of nursing staff. My experience today was the epitome of the nasty nursing culture that unfortunately nursing is known for. "Nurses eat their own young." I walked into a the nursing room and I was asked why I was asking them [the nurses] questions. If I'm an agency nurse, I was told that if I have any questions, that I should and could ask for help. I will not subject myself to this kind of mistreatment again and unfortunately will not step foot again on that nursing home campus. The nursing staff there is in dire need of an overhaul.

review_title: Loved working here, still miss it and the residents
pros: Residents, management, benefits, support for continuing education,  beautiful campus, location, affordable food. This department is small but works HARD as a team to support each other and ultimately to provide the highest quality of care possible. They truly care about the work they do and the people they serve.
cons:
Clinical staff is always changing, few staff that have been there LONG term. Work 
hard, professionally and with compassion and you will enjoy your time here.

review_title: RN for high risk residents(health care dept.)Manage work of LPNs & CNAs. Assess residents.Talk to MD. Family.
pros: Love the residents. I loved caring for the sick and elderly residents getting to know them and doing the little extras for them that made them happy
cons: A lot of agency staff all the time that don’t know how place works.  Staff not friendly   Frowned upon to get to know residents and be caring and kind. Poor pay. Can’t keep regular staff.

pros: Basic job, not too difficult but could be at times.
cons: Basically anything they tell you, you have to do.
